question: Which Indian woman cricketer has recently announced her retirement from International T20 cricket?
explanation: Jhulan Nishit Goswami, the veteran Indian women\'s team pacer, has announced her retirement from International T20 cricket. She represented India in 68 T20Is picking up 56 wickets which included a 5-wicket haul against Australia in 2012. Goswami will only play One Day International (ODIs) (as India don\'t play Test cricket), in which format she is the world\'s highest wicket-taker with 200 scalps from 169 games. She hails from a non-descript town of Chakdah in West Bengal\'s Nadia district.
